title: Establishes an animal abuser statewide registry
summary: Establishes an animal abuser statewide registry with community notification requirements.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          299

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. GLICK -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Agriculture

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation  to  estab-
         lishing an animal abuser registry

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The agriculture and markets law is amended by adding a  new
    2  section 353-e to read as follows:
    3    S  353-E. ANIMAL ABUSER REGISTRY. 1. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE
    4  TERM "ANIMAL ABUSER" MEANS A PERSON OVER EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE  WHO  HAS
    5  BEEN CONVICTED OF A FELONY VIOLATION OF ANY PROVISION OF THIS ARTICLE OR
    6  OF THE COMPARABLE STATUTES OF ANOTHER STATE.
    7    2.  ANY  ANIMAL  ABUSER PHYSICALLY WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THIS STATE
    8  FOR MORE THAN TEN CONSECUTIVE DAYS SHALL REGISTER WITH THE COUNTY  SHER-
    9  IFF  FOR THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE ANIMAL ABUSER IS LOCATED BEFORE THE END
   10  OF THE ELEVENTH DAY IN THE STATE.
   11    3. ANY PREVIOUSLY REGISTERED ANIMAL ABUSER SHALL REREGISTER  WITH  THE
   12  COUNTY  SHERIFF  FOR THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE ANIMAL ABUSER IS LOCATED NO
   13  LATER THAN TEN DAYS AFTER MOVING TO A NEW LOCATION WITHIN THE STATE.
   14    4. WHEN AN ANIMAL ABUSER REGISTERS WITH THE COUNTY SHERIFF, THE ANIMAL
   15  ABUSER SHALL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING REGISTRATION INFORMATION:
   16    (A) THE LEGAL NAME AND ANY OTHER NAMES  OR  ALIASES  THAT  THE  ANIMAL
   17  ABUSER IS USING OR HAS USED;
   18    (B) THE DATE OF BIRTH OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER;
   19    (C) THE SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER;
   20    (D) THE CURRENT ADDRESS OR LOCATION OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER;
   21    (E) THE PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER;
   22    (F)  THE  ANIMAL  PROTECTION  OFFENSE  FOR WHICH THE ANIMAL ABUSER WAS
   23  CONVICTED; AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04101-01-1

       A. 299                              2

    1    (G) THE DATE AND PLACE OF THE ANIMAL PROTECTION OFFENSE CONVICTION  OF
    2  THE ANIMAL ABUSER.
    3    5.  WHEN AN ANIMAL ABUSER REGISTERS WITH A COUNTY SHERIFF, THE SHERIFF
    4  SHALL OBTAIN:
    5    (A) A PHOTOGRAPH OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER AND A COMPLETE SET OF THE ANIMAL
    6  ABUSER'S FINGERPRINTS; AND
    7    (B) A DESCRIPTION  OF  ANY  TATTOOS,  SCARS  OR  OTHER  DISTINGUISHING
    8  FEATURES  ON  THE  ANIMAL ABUSER'S BODY THAT WOULD ASSIST IN IDENTIFYING
    9  THE ANIMAL ABUSER.
   10    6. FOLLOWING AN ANIMAL ABUSER'S INITIAL REGISTRATION PURSUANT  TO  THE
   11  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS  SECTION, AN ANIMAL ABUSER SHALL ANNUALLY RENEW THE
   12  ANIMAL ABUSER'S REGISTRATION WITH THE COUNTY SHERIFF PRIOR  TO  DECEMBER
   13  THIRTY-FIRST  OF  EACH  SUBSEQUENT CALENDAR YEAR FOR A PERIOD OF FIFTEEN
   14  YEARS.
   15    7. AN ANIMAL ABUSER WHO INTENTIONALLY OR  KNOWINGLY  FAILS  TO  COMPLY
   16  WITH  THE  REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS, OR PROVIDES FALSE INFORMATION WHEN
   17  COMPLYING WITH THE REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THIS  SECTION,
   18  IS GUILTY OF A CLASS E FELONY.
   19    8. EACH COUNTY SHERIFF SHALL MAINTAIN A LOCAL REGISTRY OF ANIMAL ABUS-
   20  ERS  IN THE SHERIFF'S JURISDICTION REQUIRED TO REGISTER PURSUANT TO THIS
   21  SECTION.
   22    9. THE COUNTY  SHERIFF  SHALL  FORWARD  ALL  REGISTRATION  INFORMATION
   23  OBTAINED  FROM ANIMAL ABUSERS TO THE NEW YORK STATE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL
   24  JUSTICE SERVICES.
   25    10. WITHIN TEN DAYS OF RECEIVING INITIAL REGISTRATION INFORMATION FROM
   26  AN ANIMAL ABUSER, THE COUNTY  SHERIFF  SHALL  CONTACT  EVERY  RESIDENCE,
   27  SCHOOL,  HUMANE  SOCIETY, ANIMAL SHELTER AND ANY OTHER BUSINESS WITHIN A
   28  HALF MILE RADIUS OF  THE  ANIMAL  ABUSER'S  RESIDENCE  OR  LOCATION  AND
   29  PROVIDE THEM WITH THE ANIMAL ABUSER'S REGISTRATION INFORMATION, WITH THE
   30  EXCEPTION OF THE ANIMAL ABUSER'S SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER.
   31    11.  THE  NEW  YORK  STATE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES SHALL
   32  MAINTAIN A CENTRAL REGISTRY  OF  ANIMAL  ABUSERS  REQUIRED  TO  REGISTER
   33  PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS SECTION. THE CENTRAL REGISTRY OF
   34  ANIMAL ABUSERS SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE  PUBLIC  THROUGH  INTERNET
   35  ACCESS,  TELEPHONE  ACCESS,  WRITTEN ACCESS AND IN-PERSON ACCESS. ALL OF
   36  THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN AN ANIMAL ABUSER'S REGISTRATION,  WITH  THE
   37  EXCEPTION  OF  THE ANIMAL ABUSER'S SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER, SHALL BE MADE
   38  AVAILABLE. RECORDS OF EACH ANIMAL ABUSER'S REGISTRATION SHALL  BE  MAIN-
   39  TAINED  FOR  THE DURATION OF THE FIFTEEN YEAR PERIOD IN WHICH THE ANIMAL
   40  ABUSER IS REQUIRED TO BE REGISTERED.
   41    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to establishing an animal abuser registry
